TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit BuildItemGroup extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.IEnumerable

remarks.format:
## Remarks A BuildItemGroup object can represent an element in the project, or a virtual collection of items, containing the items created after evaluating wildcards in the `Include` and `Exclude` attributes of an `Item` element.
## Examples The following example creates a <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.Project> object and uses the <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.Project.LoadXml%2A> method to add content to the project. The <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem>, BuildItemGroup, and <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroupCollection> classes are used to add, remove, and change items in the project.
[!code-vb[msbuild_AddNewItem#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/AddNewItem/Module1.vb#1)] [!code-cs[msbuild_AddNewItem#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/AddNewItem/Program.cs#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroup Clone(bool deepClone) cil managed

Docs.param: to create a deep copy of the ; otherwise, .
Docs.summary: Creates a deep or shallow copy of the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks A shallow copy of a <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroup> references the same property group as the original. Modifications a shallow copy will be reflected in both copies.
A deep copy of a <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroup> creates a new XML element to reference so that both copies of the <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroup> can be independently modified.
If the <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroup> corresponds directly to a element in the project (rather than corresponding to a collection of items created after evaluating wildcards in the `Include` and `Exclude` attributes of an `Item` element), only deep copies are allowed.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the `Condition` attribute value of the item group.
Docs.value: The `Condition` attribute value of the item group.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating the number of objects in the .
Docs.value: An integer value representing the number of objects in the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method allows the caller to use the `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/add/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]) to iterate through the individual <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem> objects in the <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroup>.
## Examples The following example creates a <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.Project> object and uses the <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem>, <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildProperty><xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroup>, and <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildPropertyGroup> classes to list all the items and properties in the project.
[!code-vb[msbuild_ListItemsAndProperties#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/ListItemAndPropertiesVB/Module1.vb#1)] [!code-cs[msbuild_ListItemsAndProperties#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/ListItemAndPropertiesCS/Program.cs#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the item group was imported into the project.
Docs.value: if the item group was imported into the project; otherwise, .

Docs.param: The zero-based index of the object to get or set.
Docs.summary: Gets or sets a object in this .
